cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi W of Port Charlotte, Florida and 300 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest today, then northwest and slowing as it heads toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi coastal area) late Monday into Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast between southeastern Louisiana and coastal Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL (Tropical Storm Watch); MS/AL border to AL/FL border (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Fourchon LA to MS/AL border (Storm Surge Warning); Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS (Hurricane Warning); East of Ocean Springs to Indian Pass FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward through the western Florida Panhandle; lesser impacts over Florida west-central coast including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (forecast 1–3 ft along the west-central FL coast)
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions expected but sustained gale‐force winds are not likely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible in and near Tampa Bay as onshore flow persists today.
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–3 in. with localized 6 in. could produce urban and flash flooding around the port Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along the west-central Florida coast could impact vessel operations and pilot transfers.
